courses.name: 1 Features Of Places

outcomes.description: 11 describes features of places and the connections people have with places
12 identifies ways in which people interact with and care for places
13 communicates geographical information and uses geographical tools for inquiry

inquiry_questions: 11 What are the features of, and activities in, places?
12 How can we care for places?
13 How can spaces within a place be used for different purposes?
courses.focus: 1 Students investigate the natural and human features of places. They describe the reasons places change and identify the active role of citizens in the care of places. They learn about how people describe the weather and seasons of places. Students explore activities occurring in places and how the spaces within places can be used for different purposes.

investigations.description: 11 investigate features of places and how they can be cared for
examples: 111 description of the natural and human features of places
112 discussion of the natural features of places identified in Aboriginal Dreaming stories and/or Legends of the Torres Strait
113 consideration of how a place can be cared for eg a park, farm, beach, bushland

investigations.description: 12 investigate the weather and seasons of places
examples: 121 description of the daily and seasonal weather patterns of a familiar place
122 comparison of the daily and seasonal weather patterns of places
123 examination of how different cultural groups , including Aboriginal or Torres Strait Islander Peoples, describe weather, seasons or seasonal calendars
124 discussion of how weather can affect places and activities eg leisure, farming

investigations.description: 13 investigate activities that occur within places
examples: 131 discussion of why and how the spaces within places can be rearranged for different purposes eg street fair, school hall
132 examination of why various activities in an area are located where they are eg school, shops

courses.name: 2 People and Places

outcomes.description: 21 describes features of places and the connections people have with places
22 communicates geographical information and uses geographical tools for inquiry

inquiry_questions: 21 Where are places located in Australia?
22 How are people connected to places?
23 What factors affect people's connections to places?
courses.focus: 2 Students explore places across a range of scales within Australia and Australia's location in the world. They describe connections people, including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Peoples, have with places, both locally and globally. Students identify factors affecting people's accessibility to places.

investigations.description: 21 investigate places across a range of scales within Australia
examples: 21 identification that places exist across a range of scales eg personal, local, national

investigations.description: 22 investigate Australia's location in the world
examples: 22 description of Australia's location in relation to the world eg continents, oceans

investigations.description: 23 investigate people's connections and access to places
examples: 231 discussion of why people visit other places
232 identification of factors influencing people''s accessibility to places eg distance
233 examination of how technology has improved people's access to places

investigations.description: 24 investigate connections that people, including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Peoples, have to local and global places
examples: 241 discussion of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Peoples' connections with land, sea and animals of their place
242 description of reasons people are connected to places in Australia and/or countries across the world eg birthplace
